data.title: Victoria Azarenka- Bio, Education, Career, Net Worth, Facts
data.meta_description: Victoria Azarenka, the professional tennis player, was born on July 31, 1989, in Minsk, Belarus, under the birth name Victoria Fyodorovna Azarenka. She is 34 years old. Victoria spent her early years in Minsk before making a significant move to the United States at a young age to pursue her tennis career.
data.text:
Victoria Azarenka is a professional tennis player from Belarus known for her aggressive playing style. Victoria Azarenka has achieved significant success in womenâs tennis, including winning the Australian Open singles titles in 2012 and 2013.

Early Life and Childhood

Victoria Azarenka, the professional tennis player, was born on July 31, 1989, in Minsk, Belarus, under the birth name Victoria Fyodorovna Azarenka. She is 34 years old. Victoria spent her early years in Minsk before making a significant move to the United States at a young age to pursue her tennis career.

Her parents are Fyodor Azarenka and Alla Azarenka, and she has a younger brother named Max. While specific details about her familyâs occupations are not widely available. Growing up, she showed immense talent, ultimately leading to her becoming a prominent figure in womenâs tennis.

Victoria Azarenka â Education

Victoria Azarenka pursued her college education at the Belarusian State University of Physical Education. Details about Victoria Azarenkaâs academic timeline, including when she started and completed her studies, are not extensively documented in publicly available sources.

Career and Professional Life

Victoria Azarenkaâs tennis journey began with her debut on the ITF Junior Circuit in November 2003 in Israel, where she secured a doubles title alongside Olga Govortsova.

Notably, at Wimbledon, she reached the semifinals of the girlsâ competition in 2004, showcasing her emerging talent. The following year, in 2005, Azarenka achieved significant success on the junior circuit, winning the Australian and US Open championships. Her exceptional performance led to her earning the title of the 2005 World Champion by the ITF.

In 2006, Azarenka marked her presence on the main tour by achieving her first Grand Slam match win and advancing to the third round at the US Open, a notable achievement at the time. She demonstrated her capabilities on different surfaces, including pushing the 2004 French Open champion Anastasia Myskina to a third set on clay. Despite a loss at Wimbledon, Azarenka continued to progress in her career.

The year 2007 saw Azarenkaâs rise as she reached her first WTA final and secured notable victories, including upsetting Martina Hingis at the US Open. Her mixed doubles title at the same event, alongside Max Mirnyi, added to her accomplishments. She ended the year with notable achievements at the Kremlin Cup, triumphing over Maria Sharapova and attaining career-high rankings.

In 2008, Azarenka advanced in her career, making it to the final of the Australian Womenâs Hardcourts tournament. Additionally, she achieved her first seeding in a Grand Slam singles tournament at the Australian Open. Her success extended to the doubles category, reaching the finals alongside Shahar Peâer. These achievements contributed to Azarenkaâs ascent in the rankings, reaching a career-best world No. 25.

Brand Endorsements

Victoria Azarenka, renowned as one of the most profitable stars in womenâs tennis, boasts a portfolio of lucrative brand endorsements and partnerships that have shaped her off-court image. Nike, a global sports giant, endorses Azarenka for clothing, footwear, and apparel, featuring her prominently in their promotional material.

Red Bull, a significant player in the beverage and sports industry, made history by sponsoring Azarenka in January 2013, marking her as their first tennis player ambassador. Beyond sports equipment, Azarenka has cultivated partnerships with esteemed brands such as American Express, Citizen Watch, and Six Star Pro Nutrition.

Notably, she collaborated with Citizen Watch to design an exclusive range of watches in 2013. Additionally, Azarenkaâs endorsement history includes a sponsorship deal with the investment company Instaforex between 2013 and 2016.

Awards and Nominations

Victoria Azarenkaâs illustrious tennis career is adorned with numerous awards, honours, and remarkable achievements. Azarenkaâs two Australian Open titles in 2012 and 2013 marked pivotal moments in her career.

Her success on the junior circuit included Grand Slam titles at the Australian Open and the US Open in 2005. Ascending to the world No. 1 ranking in 2012 showcased Azarenkaâs consistent prowess. Azarenkaâs sportsmanship on the court earned her the Karen Krantzcke Sportsmanship Award in 2012.

The Belarusian tennis starâs Olympic journey includes a gold medal in mixed doubles at the 2007 US Open. With a Fed Cup final appearance in 2017 and various WTA awards, including the Diamond Aces Awards, Azarenkaâs impact transcends individual victories, reflecting her enduring commitment, skill, and influence in the world of tennis.

Net Worth 2023

In August 2013, Azarenka secured the fourth spot among the highest-paid female athletes, earning $15.7 million between 2012 and 2013. Notably, her record-setting $7.9 million prize money in 2012 ranked sixth in WTA history. With a career total exceeding $28.1 million, she stands seventh among all-time WTA prize money leaders.

Relationship Status

Victoria Azarenka has had notable relationships in the past. She was in a relationship with Sergei Bubka Jr., the son of Olympic Gold medalist Sergei Bubka, from 2011 to 2012. Subsequently, Azarenka dated Billy McKeague, with whom she had a son in 2016. However, their relationship encountered challenges, and by 2017, the couple decided to part ways, leading to a custody dispute over their son.

Scandal

Victoria Azarenka has maintained a clear and relatively low profile throughout her career. Azarenka has navigated her career and personal life without being entangled in insignificant rumours or controversies.

Body Measurements

Victoria Azarenka, standing tall at 6 feet with a weight of 70 kg, possesses a strong and athletic physique. Her blue eyes and blonde hair contribute to her striking appearance. With body measurements of 37-27-38 inches, she maintains a proportionate figure, complemented by a dress size of 8 (US) and a shoe size of 9 (US).

Victoria Azarenka â Social Media

Victoria Azarenka commands a significant social media presence with 1.3 million followers on Twitter, 734,000 on Instagram, 1.3 million on Facebook, and 7,400 on TikTok. Across these platforms, she engages a diverse and dedicated fan base, sharing insights into her tennis career and personal life.
